medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent abdominal pain in the left upper quadrant (LUQ), radiating to the right upper quadrant (RUQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain initially awoke the patient from sleep and was sharp and intense, with a fever of 102.9Â°F. After taking a double dose of pain medication, the pain subsided but returned later in the day. The pain was initially in the LUQ but later radiated to the RUQ. The patient also noted red extremities and reported a return of RUQ pain, although not particularly severe, with a history of progressive bilirubin increase.
medical_history.past_medical_history: COPD on home oxygen, chronic respiratory failure with hypoventilation syndrome, morbid obesity, diabetes mellitus type II, coronary artery disease status post coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), major depression, herpes zoster, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) using BiPAP at times, patent foramen ovale (PFO), chronic stasis dermatitis, hypothyroidism, chronic pain syndrome.
medical_history.family_history: Father - heart disease, lymphoma; Mother - heart disease.
